questions.question_text: Which of the following is an objective of ADM Phase G, Implementation Governance?

choices.A: Ensure that the enterprise's Architecture Capability meets current requirements
choices.D: Prioritize the projects trough risk validation
choices.C: Ensure that implementation projects conform with the Target Architecture
choices.E: Assess the performance of the architecture and make recommendation for change

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Ensure conformance with the Target Architecture by implementation projects Perform appropriate Architecture Governance functions for the solution and any implementation-driven architecture Change Requests.

Selected Answer: C
14.1 Objectives
The objectives of Phase G are to:

Ensure conformance with the Target Architecture by implementation projects
Perform appropriate Architecture Governance functions for the solution and any implementation-driven architecture Change Requests.

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap14.html

Selected Answer: C
C. Ensure that implementation projects conform with the Target Architecture

Correct Answer

14.1 Objectives
The objectives of Phase G are to:

Ensure conformance with the Target Architecture by implementation projects
Perform appropriate Architecture Governance functions for the solution and any implementation-driven architecture Change Requests

choices.B: Creating the Statement of Architecture Work
choices.E: Determining the scope of an architecture compliance review
choices.C: Conducting assessments of the maturity level of architecture discipline within the organization

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a responsibility of an Architecture Board?

discussion.content:
A - also. 
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf7-doc/arch/p4/board/ab.htm#Responsibilities 
(Point 1: The Architecture Board is typically made responsible, and accountable, for achieving some or all of the following goals:
1. consistency between sub-architectures)

Selected Answer: A
Phase G focuses on overseeing implementation to ensure alignment with the Target Architecture, which is achieved through compliance reviews and Architecture Contracts.

Selected Answer: A
C is wrong, not "conducting", should be "improving".
The correct answer is A. It is not responsibility of architecture board to conduct maturity assessments to improve it as it is discussed on 41.2
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
47.2 Responsibilities
A is correct:
Consistency between sub-architectures
C is incorrect:
Improving the maturity level of architecture discipline within the organization


https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf91-doc/m/chap47.html

Selected Answer: A
A. Achieving consistency between sub-architectures

Selected Answer: A
A is the best answer. C is about conducting maturity assessment which is usually done by third party not the architecture board.

Correct Answer -- A -- Consistency between sub-architectures

Reference :

41.2 Responsibilities
The Architecture Board is typically made responsible, and accountable, for achieving some or all of the following goals:

Providing the basis for all decision-making with regard to the architectures
Consistency between sub-architectures
Establishing targets for re-use of components
Flexibility of the Enterprise Architecture:
To meet changing business needs
To leverage new technologies
Enforcement of Architecture Compliance
Improving the maturity level of architecture discipline within the organization
Ensuring that the discipline of architecture-based development is adopted
Supporting a visible escalation capability for out-of-bounds decisions
A.C both

comments.content:
Edit:
only A is correct. 

C is incorrect . It's not 'conducting assessment'. It's about 'improving' the maturity level
Improving the maturity level of architecture discipline within the organization
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap41.html#tag_41_02

discussion.content:
The Architecture Board is typically made responsible, and accountable, for achieving some or all
of the following goals:
■ Consistency between sub-architectures
A is rite ans

A . Following is from the responsibilities of Architecture Board from BOK
"■ Consistency between sub-architectures"

questions.question_text: Which ADM phase includes establishing the Architecture Capability and definition of Architecture Principles?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
6.1 Objectives
The objectives of the Preliminary Phase are:

Determine the Architecture Capability desired by the organization:
Review the organizational context for conducting enterprise architecture
Identify and scope the elements of the enterprise organizations affected by the Architecture Capability
Identify the established frameworks, methods, and processes that intersect with the Architecture Capability
Establish Capability Maturity target
Establish the Architecture Capability:
Define and establish the Organizational Model for Enterprise Architecture
Define and establish the detailed process and resources for architecture governance
Select and implement tools that support the Architecture Capability
Define the Architecture Principles

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf91-doc/arch/chap06.html

Correct Answer 

5.1 Objectives
The objectives of the Preliminary Phase are to:

Determine the Architecture Capability desired by the organization:
Review the organizational context for conducting Enterprise Architecture
Identify and scope the elements of the enterprise organizations affected by the Architecture Capability
Identify the established frameworks, methods, and processes that intersect with the Architecture Capability
Establish Capability Maturity target
Establish the Architecture Capability:
Define and establish the Organizational Model for Enterprise Architecture
Define and establish the detailed process and resources for Architecture Governance
Select and implement tools that support the Architecture Capability
Define the Architecture Principles

choices.A: Generic data models relevant to the organization's industry sector
choices.C: Generic technology models relevant to the organization's industry sector

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
11.5.2 Architecture Repository
As part of Phase D, the architecture team will need to consider what relevant Technology Architecture resources are available in the Architecture Repository (see Part V, 37. Architecture Repository ).
In particular:
• Generic technology models relevant to the organization's industry "vertical" sector; for example:
• Technology models relevant to Common Systems Architectures

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap11.html
Correct Answer

questions.question_text: Which one of the following is considered a relevant architecture resource in ADM Phase D?
The TOGAF ADM uses version numbering to illustrate the evolution of Baseline and Target Architecture Definitions. Which version number is used to indicate a high-level outline of the architecture?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
4.2.2 Basic Structure
Table 4-1: ADM Version Numbering Convention
Version 0.1 indicates that a high-level outline of the architecture is in place.

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap04.html
